                             ===Issue===                                                                                                                                                                         
                             ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                                                                                             
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Summary                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             The fuzzing session terminated with an ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout, indicating that the fuzzer exceeded its allotted execution time without completing its run.                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Description                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             - Issue statement                                                                                                                                                                   
                               During a libFuzzer-driven test, the process did not finish within the configured timeout threshold and was aborted by the fuzzer framework. The log entry is                      
                             simply ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout.                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             - Vulnerability type                                                                                                                                                                
                               No specific vulnerability class (e.g., memory corruption, undefined behavior) is reported in the issue; the message solely denotes a performance or                               
                             executiontime interruption.                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             - Important observations and findings                                                                                                                                               
                                The harness code serves only as the fuzzers entry point and is not itself the root cause.                                                                                      
                                The timeout suggests that one or more code paths exercised by the fuzzer are taking excessively long or never return.                                                           
                                There are no stack traces or logs indicating crashes or sanitizer reportsthis is strictly a timing interruption.                                                               
                                The issue may surface under particular input conditions or code paths that induce heavy computation, blocking I/O, or infinite loops.                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             - Codebase areas to investigate for a holistic view                                                                                                                                 
                               1. Fuzzer harness entry function (e.g., LLVMFuzzerTestOneInput) to identify which modules and functions are under test.                                                           
                               2. Core processing routines invoked by the harness, especially loops or recursive calls that can consume unbounded CPU time.                                                      
                               3. Any external or blocking operations (file I/O, network calls, synchronization primitives) reachable from the harness.                                                          
                               4. Performance-sensitive algorithms or data structures that may degrade sharply on certain inputs.                                                                                
                               5. Test setup and teardown logic for potential deadlocks or waits that never resolve.                                                                                             
                               6. Build and runtime fuzzer configurations (timeout settings, coverage options) to confirm they match expected test parameters.                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Initial Issue Log                                                                                                                                                                
                             Here is the initial issue log of the codebase:

                             </code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Fix Strategy                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             1. **Problem Analysis and Root Cause**                                                                                                                                              
                                The fuzz harness is timing out because the default XSSF usermodel path (`XSSFSheet.onDocumentRead`  `WorksheetDocument.Factory.parse`) performs an unbounded                    
                             DOM parse on the entire sheet XML, and `initRows` then iterates every row element. Similarly, even the streamingbased sharedstrings and sheetXML handlers visit                  
                             all XML events and build unbounded inmemory structures. Malicious or extremely large XML inputs can therefore consume unbounded CPU/time, causing libFuzzer                        
                             timeouts.                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             2. **High-Level Fix Approach**                                                                                                                                                      
                                Introduce configurable, perXML-payload size and elementcount limits that will abort parsing early if an abusive input exceeds reasonable bounds. This                          
                             preserves normal Excel file processing while giving the fuzzer quick feedback on pathological cases instead of stalling.                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             3. **Detailed Patch Strategy**                                                                                                                                                      
                                a. **Define Limits in a Central Configuration**                                                                                                                                  
                                   - Create a new class `POIXMLProperties` (or extend an existing POI config class) with defaults and setters/getters for:                                                       
                                      `maxSheetXmlBytes` (e.g. 50 MB)                                                                                                                                           
                                      `maxSharedStringsBytes` (e.g. 10 MB)                                                                                                                                      
                                      `maxRowsPerSheet` (e.g. 1 000 000)                                                                                                                                        
                                   - Allow overrides via system properties, environment variables, or a programmatic API so users can tweak thresholds as needed.                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                b. **Implement a Counting/Limiting InputStream**                                                                                                                                 
                                   - Add an internal `LimitInputStream extends FilterInputStream` that counts bytes read and throws an `IOException` when the configured byte limit is exceeded.                 
                                   - This stream can be very lightweight (just a long counter and maxBytes check in every `read()`).                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                c. **Apply Limits to DOMBased Sheet Parsing**                                                                                                                                   
                                   - In `XSSFSheet.read(InputStream is)` (called from `onDocumentRead`), wrap the raw stream:                                                                                    
                                      ```                                                                                                                                                                        
                                      InputStream limited = new LimitInputStream(is, POIXMLProperties.getMaxSheetXmlBytes());                                                                                    
                                      WorksheetDocument wsDoc = WorksheetDocument.Factory.parse(limited, DEFAULT_XML_OPTIONS);                                                                                   
                                      worksheet = wsDoc.getWorksheet();                                                                                                                                          
                                      ```                                                                                                                                                                        
                                   - Catch the `IOException` from `LimitInputStream` and rethrow as a `POIXMLException("Sheet XML exceeds maximum allowed size", e)`.                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                d. **Apply Limits to SharedStrings SAX Parsing**                                                                                                                                
                                   - In `ReadOnlySharedStringsTable.readFrom(InputStream is)`, wrap the incoming stream in a `LimitInputStream` using `getMaxSharedStringsBytes()`.                              
                                   - Any over-limit read throws `IOException`, caught and wrapped in a `SAXException` to abort parsing.                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                e. **Apply Limits to Row Iteration**                                                                                                                                             
                                   - In `XSSFSheet.initRows()`, introduce a simple row counter:                                                                                                                 
                                     ```                                                                                                                                                                         
                                     int rowCount = 0;                                                                                                                                                           
                                     for (CTRow row : worksheet.getSheetData().getRowList()) {                                                                                                                   
                                         if (++rowCount > POIXMLProperties.getMaxRowsPerSheet()) {                                                                                                               
                                             throw new POIXMLException(                                                                                                                                          
                                                "Number of rows exceeds maximum allowed (" + rowCount + ")");                                                                                                    
                                         }                                                                                                                                                                       
                                         // existing row initialization logic                                                                                                                                    
                                     }                                                                                                                                                                           
                                     ```                                                                                                                                                                         
                                   - This ensures we never spin through millions of rows when under fuzzer attack.                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             4. **How This Preserves Existing Behavior**                                                                                                                                         
                                - **Default thresholds** are high enough not to impact typical Excel files or existing testcases.                                                                                
                                - **Configurable properties** let advanced users raise or lower limits for special use-cases.                                                                                    
                                - **Error path** still throws a `POIXMLException`, so calling code treats it as a parse failure. No silent skips or major rework of public APIs.                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             5. **Why This Resolves the Timeout**                                                                                                                                                
                                By bounding both raw XML size and row counts, adversarial inputs that would previously cause the parser to consume unbounded time and memory will instead                        
                             trigger a controlled exception once the threshold is crossed. The fuzzer harness thus sees a fastfailing parse rather than a hung or excessively slow one,                         
                             eliminating timeout errors in the majority of cases.                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             6. **Side Effects & Mitigations**                                                                                                                                                   
                                - **False positives** if legitimate large documents exceed defaults. Mitigate by allowing configuration of the limits.                                                           
                                - **Minor performance overhead** from wrapping streams and counting bytes; this is negligible compared to full DOM parsing.                                                      
                                - Existing unit/integration tests remain valid, since they wont exceed the default limits.                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             7. **No Changes to Harness or Tests**                                                                                                                                               
                                - All changes are confined to production code in the `poi-ooxml` module.                                                                                                         
                                - No modifications to any fuzz harness, test fixtures, or external dependencies.                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                     
                             ===Evaluation End===

                             ... [TRUNCATED]                                                                                                                                                                     
                             ===Issue===                                                                                                                                                                         
                             ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                                                                                             
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Summary                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             The initial issue reported by libFuzzer was a timeout which indicates that certain parsing operations in Apache POIs XSSF and event-based modules were taking                    
                             too long under fuzzing. The proposed patch wraps input streams in a `LimitInputStream` (constraining XML and shared-strings sizes based on `POIXMLProperties`) and                  
                             adds a row-count check via a new `initRows` method in `XSSFSheet` to abort on excessively large sheets. After applying the patch, compilation fails in                              
                             `XSSFSheet.java` with illegal start of expression errors, indicating that the new method was inserted improperly (likely inside another methods scope).                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Description                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             1. Initial Issue                                                                                                                                                                    
                                - The fuzzing harness reported `ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout`, meaning that some XML parsing code paths did not complete within the fuzzers time budget.                           
                                - No stack trace or exception was shown; only the timeout itself.                                                                                                                
                                - Observations: timeouts often point to unbounded loops or very large inputs being parsed without checks.                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             2. Patch Attempt                                                                                                                                                                    
                                - In `XSSFSheet.java`:                                                                                                                                                           
                                   Imported `org.apache.poi.poixml.POIXMLProperties` and `LimitInputStream`.                                                                                                    
                                   Modified `protected void read(InputStream is)` to wrap `is` in `new LimitInputStream(is, POIXMLProperties.getMaxSheetXmlBytes())` before parsing the                         
                             worksheet XML.                                                                                                                                                                      
                                   Added a private method `initRows(Worksheet worksheet)` that iterates over `worksheet.getSheetData().getRowList()`, enforces a maximum row count from                         
                             `POIXMLProperties.getMaxRowsPerSheet()`, and builds `XSSFRow` objects.                                                                                                              
                                - In `ReadOnlySharedStringsTable.java`:                                                                                                                                          
                                   Imported the same two classes.                                                                                                                                               
                                   Wrapped the passed `InputStream` in a `LimitInputStream(is, POIXMLProperties.getMaxSharedStringsBytes())` before creating the `PushbackInputStream`.                         
                                - Aim: introduce size limits on sheet XML and shared-strings to prevent excessively large inputs from stalling or OOM conditions.                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             3. Patch Result                                                                                                                                                                     
                                - Build halted in `poi-ooxml` module.                                                                                                                                            
                                - Compiler errors in `XSSFSheet.java` at the insertion point of `initRows`:                                                                                                      
                                   illegal start of expression                                                                                                                                                
                                   ; expected                                                                                                                                                               
                                - These errors indicate the new method declaration was placed inside another method or block, violating Java syntax.                                                             
                                - No runtime or fuzzing logs beyond the compile failure were produced.                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             4. Areas for Further Investigation                                                                                                                                                  
                                - XSSFSheet.java around line 335345: confirm matching braces around existing methods and ensure `initRows` is declared at class scope.                                          
                                - The `addMergedRegion` method (where the patch diff context was taken) to see if braces were shifted or misaligned by the diff.                                                 
                                - The imports and package declarations in `XSSFSheet.java` to ensure no duplicate imports or missing semicolons.                                                                 
                                - The analogous changes in `ReadOnlySharedStringsTable.java` to verify that they compile and that they align with the coding style of the module.                                
                                - `POIXMLProperties` and `LimitInputStream` classes to confirm they are on the compile classpath and provide the intended static methods.                                        
                                - Any tooling (formatter, code style checks) that might have reordered braces or eliminated necessary separators during the patch application.                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Initial Issue Log                                                                                                                                                                
                             Here is the initial issue log of the codebase:                                                                                                                                      
                             <issue>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </issue>

                             52:import org.apache.poi.ss.util.SheetUtil;                                                                                                                                         
                             53:import org.apache.poi.util.Beta;                                                                                                                                                 
                             54:import org.apache.poi.util.Internal;                                                                                                                                             
                             55:import org.apache.poi.util.Removal;                                                                                                                                              
                             56:import org.apache.poi.util.Units;                                                                                                                                                
                             57:import org.apache.poi.xssf.model.Comments;                                                                                                                                       
                             58:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFPivotTable.PivotTableReferenceConfigurator;                                                                                             
                             59:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.helpers.ColumnHelper;                                                                                                                       
                             60:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.helpers.XSSFColumnShifter;                                                                                                                  
                             61:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.helpers.XSSFIgnoredErrorHelper;                                                                                                             
                             62:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.helpers.XSSFRowShifter;                                                                                                                     
                             63:import org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlCursor;                                                                                                                                            
                             64:import org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlException;                                                                                                                                         
                             65:import org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject;                                                                                                                                            
                             66:import org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlOptions;                                                                                                                                           
                             67:import org.openxmlformats.schemas.spreadsheetml.x2006.main.*;                                                                                                                    
                             68:                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             69:/**                                                                                                                                                                              
                             70: * High level representation of a SpreadsheetML worksheet.                                                                                                                       
                             71: *                                                                                                                                                                               
                             72: * <p>                                                                                                                                                                           
                             73: * Sheets are the central structures within a workbook, and are where a user does most of his spreadsheet work.                                                                  
                             74: * The most common type of sheet is the worksheet, which is represented as a grid of cells. Worksheet cells can                                                                  
                             75: * contain text, numbers, dates, and formulas. Cells can also be formatted.                                                                                                      
                             76: * </p>                                                                                                                                                                          
                             77: */                                                                                                                                                                              
                             78:public class XSSFSheet extends POIXMLDocumentPart implements Sheet, OoxmlSheetExtensions  {                                                                                      
                             79:    private static final Logger LOG = PoiLogManager.getLogger(XSSFSheet.class);                                                                                                  
                             80:                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             81:    private static final double DEFAULT_ROW_HEIGHT = 15.0;                                                                                                                       
                             82:    private static final double DEFAULT_MARGIN_HEADER = 0.3;                                                                                                                     
                             83:    private static final double DEFAULT_MARGIN_FOOTER = 0.3;                                                                                                                     
                             84:    private static final double DEFAULT_MARGIN_TOP = 0.75;                                                                                                                       
                             85:    private static final double DEFAULT_MARGIN_BOTTOM = 0.75;                                                                                                                    
                             86:    private static final double DEFAULT_MARGIN_LEFT = 0.7;                                                                                                                       
                             87:    private static final double DEFAULT_MARGIN_RIGHT = 0.7;                                                                                                                      
                             88:                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             89:    //TODO make the two variable below private!                                                                                                                                  
                             90:    protected CTSheet sheet;                                                                                                                                                     
                             91:    protected CTWorksheet worksheet;                                                                                                                                             
                             92:                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             93:    private final SortedMap<Integer, XSSFRow> _rows = new TreeMap<>();                                                                                                           
                             94:    private List<XSSFHyperlink> hyperlinks;                                                                                                                                      
                             95:    private ColumnHelper columnHelper;                                                                                                                                           
                             96:    private Comments sheetComments;                                                                                                                                              
                             97:    /**                                                                                                                                                                          
                             98:     * cache of master shared formulas in this sheet.                                                                                                                            
                             99:     * Master shared formula is the first formula in a group of shared formulas is saved in the f element.                                                                       
                             100:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             poi-ooxml/src/main/java/org/apache/poi/xssf/usermodel/XSSFSheet.java:300-370                                                                                                        
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             300:     * @throws IllegalStateException if region intersects with an existing region on this sheet                                                                                 
                             301:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             302:    @Override                                                                                                                                                                   
                             303:    public int addMergedRegion(CellRangeAddress region) {                                                                                                                       
                             304:        return addMergedRegion(region, true);                                                                                                                                   
                             305:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             306:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             307:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             308:     * Adds a merged region of cells (hence those cells form one).                                                                                                              
                             309:     * Skips validation. It is possible to create overlapping merged regions                                                                                                    
                             310:     * or create a merged region that intersects a multi-cell array formula                                                                                                     
                             311:     * with this formula, which may result in a corrupt workbook.                                                                                                               
                             312:     *                                                                                                                                                                          
                             313:     * To check for merged regions overlapping array formulas or other merged regions                                                                                           
                             314:     * after addMergedRegionUnsafe has been called, call {@link #validateMergedRegions()}, which runs in O(n^2) time.                                                           
                             315:     *                                                                                                                                                                          
                             316:     * @param region to merge                                                                                                                                                   
                             317:     * @return index of this region                                                                                                                                             
                             318:     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if region contains fewer than 2 cells                                                                                                   
                             319:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             320:    @Override                                                                                                                                                                   
                             321:    public int addMergedRegionUnsafe(CellRangeAddress region) {                                                                                                                 
                             322:        return addMergedRegion(region, false);                                                                                                                                  
                             323:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             324:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             325:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             326:     * Adds a merged region of cells (hence those cells form one).                                                                                                              
                             327:     * If validate is true, check to make sure adding the merged region to the sheet doesn't create a corrupt workbook                                                          
                             328:     * If validate is false, skips the expensive merged region checks, but may produce a corrupt workbook.                                                                      
                             329:     *                                                                                                                                                                          
                             330:     * @param region to merge                                                                                                                                                   
                             331:     * @param validate whether to validate merged region                                                                                                                        
                             332:     * @return 0-based index of this region                                                                                                                                     
                             333:     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if region contains fewer than 2 cells (this check is inexpensive and is performed regardless of {@code validate})                       
                             334:     * @throws IllegalStateException if region intersects with a multi-cell array formula                                                                                       
                             335:     * @throws IllegalStateException if region intersects with an existing region on this sheet                                                                                 
                             336:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             337:    private int addMergedRegion(CellRangeAddress region, boolean validate) {                                                                                                    
                             338:        if (region.getNumberOfCells() < 2) {                                                                                                                                    
                             339:            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Merged region " + region.formatAsString() + " must contain 2 or more cells");                                                   
                             340:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             341:        region.validate(SpreadsheetVersion.EXCEL2007);                                                                                                                          
                             342:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             343:        if (validate) {                                                                                                                                                         
                             344:            // throw IllegalStateException if the argument CellRangeAddress intersects with                                                                                     
                             345:            // a multi-cell array formula defined in this sheet                                                                                                                 
                             346:            validateArrayFormulas(region);                                                                                                                                      
                             347:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             348:            // Throw IllegalStateException if the argument CellRangeAddress intersects with                                                                                     
                             349:            // a merged region already in this sheet                                                                                                                            
                             350:            validateMergedRegions(region);                                                                                                                                      
                             351:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             352:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             353:        CTMergeCells ctMergeCells = worksheet.isSetMergeCells() ? worksheet.getMergeCells() : worksheet.addNewMergeCells();                                                     
                             354:        CTMergeCell ctMergeCell = ctMergeCells.addNewMergeCell();                                                                                                               
                             355:        ctMergeCell.setRef(region.formatAsString());                                                                                                                            
                             356:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             357:        long count = ctMergeCells.getCount();                                                                                                                                   
                             358:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             359:        if (count == 0) {                                                                                                                                                       
                             360:            count=ctMergeCells.sizeOfMergeCellArray();                                                                                                                          
                             361:        } else {                                                                                                                                                                
                             362:            count++;                                                                                                                                                            
                             363:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             364:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             365:        // also adjust the number of merged regions overall                                                                                                                     
                             366:        ctMergeCells.setCount(count);                                                                                                                                           
                             367:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             368:        return Math.toIntExact(count-1);                                                                                                                                        
                             369:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             370:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             poi-ooxml/src/main/java/org/apache/poi/xssf/usermodel/XSSFSheet.java:1-120                                                                                                          
                             ```

                             42:import org.apache.poi.ss.formula.FormulaShifter;                                                                                                                                 
                             43:import org.apache.poi.ss.formula.SheetNameFormatter;                                                                                                                             
                             44:import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.*;

                             49:import org.apache.poi.ss.util.CellReference;                                                                                                                                     
                             50:import org.apache.poi.ss.util.PaneInformation;                                                                                                                                   
                             51:import org.apache.poi.ss.util.SSCellRange;                                                                                                                                       
                             52:import org.apache.poi.ss.util.SheetUtil;                                                                                                                                         
                             53:import org.apache.poi.util.Beta;                                                                                                                                                 
                             54:import org.apache.poi.util.Internal;                                                                                                                                             
                             55:import org.apache.poi.util.Removal;                                                                                                                                              
                             56:import org.apache.poi.util.Units;                                                                                                                                                
                             57:import org.apache.poi.xssf.model.Comments;                                                                                                                                       
                             58:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFPivotTable.PivotTableReferenceConfigurator;                                                                                             
                             59:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.helpers.ColumnHelper;                                                                                                                       
                             60:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.helpers.XSSFColumnShifter;                                                                                                                  
                             61:import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.helpers.XSSFIgnoredErrorHelper;

                             63:import org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlCursor;                                                                                                                                            
                             64:import org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlException;
